title: Public Utility Enforcement Officer
description:
THE POSITION

Would you like to work independently in a unique law enforcement setting, be home based for the beginning and end of each shift, and have weekends and holidays off? Become a Public Utility Enforcement Officer for the Public Utility Commission (PUC)! This position patrols Erie and Warren counties to protect the motoring public by placing unsafe vehicles and drivers out-of-service. Apply today for this meaningful career opportunity!

DESCRIPTION OF WORK

This Public Utility Enforcement Officer position is part of the uniformed PUC Motor Carrier Enforcement Division and primarily covers Erie and Warren counties. This officer has the authority to stop and inspect all commercial motor vehicles to ensure they are in safe operating condition. This includes conducting inspections of both drivers and vehicles, completing safety audits, issuing citations and complaints when necessary, testifying at court hearings, and conducting investigations of consumer and agency-initiated complaints of motor carriers. Utilize and grow your knowledge of pertinent Public Utility statutes and regulations, the Pennsylvania Vehicle Code, Pennsylvania Department of Transportation Vehicle Equipment and Inspection Manual, the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations, and the Hazardous Material Regulations to keep our highways safe.

Your work will ensure that that new motor carriers have the knowledge they need regarding the regulations and safety management practices in place. You may also have the opportunity to work side by side and in conjunction with state and local police with the goal of preventing and reducing the number injuries and fatalities involving commercial motor vehicles. Join our dedicated and valued team today!

Work Schedule and Additional Information:

 Full-time employment  Work hours are 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM, Monday - Friday, with a 60-minute lunch.  The counties of patrol are ERIE and WARREN.  This is a home-headquartered position. You must reside in Erie or Warren County or be willing to relocate within six months of employment.  Additional travel may be required, including travel to the headquarters office in Pittsburgh.  Salary:In some cases, the starting salary may be non-negotiable.  You will receive further communication regarding this position via email. Check your email, including spam/junk folders, for these notices. 

Required Experience, Training & Eligibility

QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum Experience and Training Requirements:

 Four years of enforcement experience with a governmental regulatory agency’s laws, rules and regulations pertaining to motor vehicles; or  Four years of professional police experience; or  Graduation from a four-year college or university with major course work in police sciences or law enforcement; or  Any equivalent combination of experience and training.  Applicants will be considered to have met the educational requirements once they are within 3 months of graduating with a qualifying degree. 

Special Requirement:

 You must possess a valid motor vehicle operator’s license issued by the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. 

Condition of Employment: 

 You must successfully complete the required training and safety courses within six months of employment. 

Other Requirements:

 You must meet the PA residency requirement . For more information on ways to meet PA residency requirements, follow the link and click on Residency.  Hiring preference for this vacancy may be given to candidates who live within Erie or Warren counties. If no eligible candidates who live within these counties apply for this position, candidates who reside in other counties may be considered.  You must be able to perform essential job functions.

title: 2nd Shift Test Production Associate
description:
Description

Test Production Associate

Our culture believes in POWERING YOUR POTENTIAL . We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.

We believe in flexibility for you to explore your passions while making an impact through meaningful work within our inclusive workforce. That’s what is all about.

We are looking for a talented Test Production Associate to join our team specializing in MANUFACTURING for our Engine Business Segment in Rocky Mount, NC.

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:

Operates machines and production equipment in accordance with quality and productivity requirements safely in a manufacturing environment with direct guidance.Report any work-related injury, illness, incident or hazard.Use appropriate personal protective equipment.Comply with HSE standards, policies, procedures & regulations.Correct hazards within your control and capabilities.Engage in HSE Training.Performs quality inspections.

To be successful in this role you will need the following:

Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.Nimble learning - Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder.Health and Safety Fundamentals - Champions and models proactive health and safety behaviors by identifying, reporting and participating in actions to improve health and safety in order to build an interdependent culture and contribute to an injury-free workplace.

Compensation And Benefits

Base salary rate commensurate with experience. Additional benefits vary between locations and include options such as our 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Cash Balance Pension Plan, Medical/Dental/Life Insurance, Health Savings Account, Domestic Partners Coverage and a full complement of personal and professional benefits.

Cummins and E-verify

At Cummins, we are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law. Cummins validates right to work using E-Verify. Cummins will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Job MANUFACTURING

Primary Location United States-North Carolina-Rocky Mount-US, NC, Rocky Mount, CDC Case-Cummins

Job Type Shop

Recruitment Job Type Shop

title: Driver License Examiner w/CDL (Reading)
description:
THE POSITION

Drive your career forward! The Department of Transportation is seeking a Driver License Examiner to conduct standardized knowledge and skills examinations to evaluate the skill and competence of non-commercial and Commercial Driver License (CDL) applicants. Being bilingual in Spanish would be a great benefit.

The hiring office for this posting has a continuing need for Spanish speaking applicants. Individuals fluent in both English and Spanish are encouraged to apply. Individuals hired for these positions provide information and assistance to Spanish-speaking customers.

DESCRIPTION OF WORK

In this position you will conduct standardized On Road examinations to evaluate the skill and competence of Non-Commercial Driver License and Commercial Driver License applicants safely and courteously. You will d etermine the physical conditions and driving qualifications of an applicant and the mechanical condition of vehicles in conformance with established guidelines and standards.

You will also perform pre-trip inspections of vehicles before administering the driving tests and checks motor vehicles for inspection stickers, lights, windshield wipers and other mechanical features to ensure safety and for knowledge of the controls by the applicant. Examines applications, registrations and permits for possible irregularities and fraud.

You will administer the CDL and Non-CDL knowledge examination that tests applicants for knowledge and understanding of the motor vehicle code and traffic signs. Evaluate the applicant's ability in practical demonstration of motor vehicle operation and observance of the rules of the road.

Upon request of the Driver License Division Management Team, audits Third Party Examiners for contract compliance by either having the Third Party Examiner administer a CDL skills test to the Department Examiner in a representative vehicle or scoring along with the Third Party Examiner while administering a CDL skills test to an applicant. You will administer telebinocular, color perception, and other tests of vision. Strictly adheres to all aspects of the Driver and Vehicle Services Customer Service Policy.

 Full-time employment.  Work hours are 8:15 AM to 4:45 PM, Tuesday - Saturday, with 30-minute lunch.  Overtime and travel required.  Salary:In some cases, the starting salary may be non-negotiable.
